results.title: A Year to Remember 1937
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1937 - Coronation of George VI at Westminster Abbey - Japan looking for steel to feed her furnaces - Rise of General Franco and the outbreak of the Civil War - Lyons re-elected - Sydney’s last steam train - Stinson monoplane disappears over Lamington National park - Zeppelin ‘Hindenberg’ goes up in flames - Hubert Opperman cycles from Perth to Melbourne … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1936
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1936 - Funeral of King George V - Abdication - Memorial to Bert Hinkler in Bundaberg - Queen Mary leaves Southampton on maiden voyage - Young woman prepares for a boxing match with male opponent - Bullock teams used to get bales to wool ships - Cavalry in training - a parade by 1,000 Light Horsemen - Dancing at Sydney’s Palais Royal - Jockey Jimmy Pike retires … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1935
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1935 - Joseph Lyons leaves for Imperial Conference in London - Lord Baden Powell at Jamboree in Frankston, Victoria - Search for oil at Roma, SE Queensland - General Motors plant at Woodville, SA - Three people killed by sharks - Aircraft building industry - First aerial film ever taken of Central Australia - Smithy lost over the Bay of Bengal - 200 foot python goes on strike at Taronga Park Zoo…and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1934
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage which made up Australia’s history in 1934 - King George, Queen Mary and Prince of Wales visit Australia - Locust plague and hunting the ‘pest’ kangaroo - Tasmanian wolf close to extinction - Camels in Adelaide - Louis Bleriot’s first crossing of the English Channel - Charles Ulm disappears between California and Australia - England to Australia air race - Australia wins the Ashes - Peter Pan wins the Melbourne Cup … and much more. results.title: A Year to Remember 1933
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage, which made up Australia’s history in 1933 - Kingsford-Smith arrives in Brisbane - Royal Navy destroyers - Gift from British Government - Discovery of gold in Australia, Los Angeles - Heavyweight boxer, Primo Carnera, fights kangaroo, Billycart racing at Bellevue Hill, Sydney - Fashions for women - Bondi Beach- Bodyline bowling creates controversy- Great trotting pacer Walla Walla… and much more. results.title: A Year to Remember 1932
results.brief_description: Collection of newsreel footage, which made up Australia’s history in 1932 - The Depression - Opening the Sydney Harbour Bridge - De Groot cuts ribbon - Hiking. Popular pastime in the Depression - Annette Kellerman at home-coming reception - Boy Charlton swimming events - Wizard Smith breaks the world land speed record - US sailors die trying to bring the dirigible ‘Akron’ down - Kingsford-Smith congratulates Scotty - and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year to Remember 1931
results.brief_description: This unique collection of film brings together all the drama, the fun, the people, the sport and the lifestyles which made up Australia’s history from 1931 through to 1956. The Depression - Horses bringing in the wheat Jack Lang, NSW Premier - Disappearance of the Southern Cloud - Sir Douglas Mawson welcomed back - Attempt to split the atom - Building of Sydney Harbour Bridge - Earthquake scenes at Hawkes Bay NZ - Dame Nellie Melba’s funeral - Sir Malcolm Campbell in the Bluebird … and much more. Rated: G

results.title: A Year of change in three children (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Cognitive Development”.
It is not until 5 years old or so that children come to understand the notions of conservation of area, length and weight. This program, recorded at Nottingham primary school, examines the responses of three children to various Piagetian tests over a period of one year.

results.title: A Year in Provence
results.creator_credit: Ken Riddington, BBC and David Tucker
results.brief_description: Based on Peter Mayles’ best selling novel, Peter and his wife Annie decide to take “Le Plunge” and abandon the rat-race of England to live in an old farmhouse at the foot of the Luberon Mountains in Provence. Coping with the language and the idiosyncratic behaviour and customs of the locals form the basis of their daily life.
